Name: oid
Description: row identifier (hidden attribute; must be explicitly selected)

Name: rolinherit
Description: role automatically inherits privileges of roles it is a member of

Name: rolcatupdate
Description: role can update system catalogs directly. (even a superuser cannot do this unless this column is true)

Name: rolcanlogin
Description: role can log in. that is, this role can be given as the initial session authorization identifier

Name: rolreplication
Description: role is a replication role. that is, this role can initiate streaming replication (see section 25.2.5) and set/unset the system backup mode using pg_start_backup and pg_stop_backup

Name: rolconnlimit
Description: for roles that can log in, this sets maximum number of concurrent connections this role can make. -1 means no limit.

Name: rolpassword
Description: password (possibly encrypted); null if none. if the password is encrypted, this column will begin with the string md5 followed by a 32-character hexadecimal md5 hash. the md5 hash will be of the user's password concatenated to their user name. for example, if user joe has password xyzzy, postgresql will store the md5 hash of xyzzyjoe. a password that does not follow that format is assumed to be unencrypted.

Name: rolvaliduntil
Description: password expiry time (only used for password authentication); null if no expiration
